actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title IV of the Social Security Act to allow the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award competitive grants to enhance collaboration between State child welfare and juvenile justice systems.
short_title: Childhood Outcomes Need New Efficient Community Teams

summary.text:
Childhood Outcomes Need New Efficient Community Teams or the CONNECT Act

This bill amends title IV of the Social Security Act to authorize the Department of Health and Human Services to make grants to state child welfare and juvenile justice agencies to:

 collaborate in the collection of data relating to dual status youth (who come into contact with both the child welfare and juvenile justice systems and occupy various statuses in his or her relationship to those systems); and develop practices, policies, and protocols to confront the challenges presented and experienced by such youth.

titles.title: Childhood Outcomes Need New Efficient Community Teams

A bill to amend title IV of the Social Security Act to allow the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award competitive grants to enhance collaboration between State child welfare and juvenile justice systems.
